reviews.review_msg: He was such a hard marker! No matter how much effort I had put in, he marked everything by the standards of what you would expect from a graduate student. Definitely not a GPA booster with him as the T.A. for this class. Highly not recommended, your GPA will be screwed.
Always willing to meet with students and give detailed feedback on your work. The course material was interesting and the lectures were very detailed and easy to follow.
Eloquent, insightful, straightforward, and cares for her students.
Susan is a really caring professor who definitely supplies her students with the tools for success. Her short story selections were very interesting and good to read.
Great prof.  Lively, creative lectures, and also helpful in her office hours.

Susan is a wicked prof. her classes are very interesting and engaging and you can tell that she tries hard to make it that way by relating course material to many different aspects of popular culture. Definately consider taking a class with her.
She's an okay professor, however, the course content doesn't excite me in any way and my TA is a hard marker. What do I have to say about the course overall? Meh.

I took this class a few semesters back. She is an awesome professor, but the TA's for her class were terrible.  She was super nice and always available. She needed better TA's, as they didn't do very much - as most of them don't.
Relating everything in literature to your experience raising a child is not teaching.
Nadine is definately an intelligent person; however, I found her lectures to be quite repetitive and dry.

She's nice , but has yet to tell the class anything about literature a pompous fifteen year old couldn't have come up with. Also, says everything like it it the...most...important...thing... you've...ever... heard.

Has a huge thing for post-colonialism... quite eccentric, fair marker, relatively easy course... likes to talk about his personal life and his own publishment a lot. has a sense of humour, occasionally does extremely bizarre things in lecture. A cool prof
No Comments

He is clearly very talented and very intelligent, but he just can't quite seem to communicate that to us. I don't think he doesn't care, I just think that *teaching* is not necessarily his strong suit.
She is a wonderful teacher, makes lectures super interesting, is very flexible with the assignments and encourages creativity, the BEST English prof I have had so far.
His apocalyptic lit class is one of the best courses I've ever taken at SFU. Love his classic lecture style, would love to do a course like this again.

Intelligent man, but personally I found him hard to listen to. Lectures had no structure, no notes or overheads, was complete talk. Has a tendency to ramble and repeat himself which makes it hard to judge what we need to write down and what we can ignore. Some kind of simple overhead/slides with key headings would help in a big way.
jeff is an awesome prof. doesn't seem like a prof, more like another classmate, but more intellectual. i thought he was GREATTTTTTTTTTT! and very open to different ideas.
Has a Toni Morrison fetish

refreshing, insightful overview of modern, post-modern and contemporary literature. Lectures give you a feeling of where literature is headed in the 21st century. Interested in the literary world? Take this class.
great prof, interesting lectures, and yeah, not much more to say
